title: STATE POLICE: 6 injured in two separate shootings in Halifax
content:
HALIFAX, VA (WWBT) -
Virginia State Police are investigating two shootings in the Town of Halifax that left six people injured including the suspected shooter.
Troopers say shortly before 2 a.m. Sunday, the Halifax County Sheriff’s Office responded to a parking complaint called in by a security officer at the VFW Hall on Route 501. They say upon arrival, a deputy heard a sudden burst of gunfire and witnessed a male subject firing into a crowd of people. Investigators say the accused shooter refused to comply with the deputy’s commands to drop the weapon and was subsequently shot by the deputy.
The suspect is currently being treated for non-life threatening injuries.The deputy was not injured.
They tell us a total of five other individuals were injured in the initial shooting incident. One is being treated for life-threatening injuries, and a second person is being treated for serious injuries. Three others have already been treated and released from Sentara Halifax Regional Hospital in South Boston.
At the request of Halifax County Sheriff Fred Clark, the Virginia State Police Bureau of Criminal Investigation’s Appomattox Field Office is investigating both the initial shooting and deputy-involved shooting.
